title: Election Commission rejects BS Yeddyurappa's charges of poll fraud
article_body: BENGALURU: Karnataka’s Chief Electoral Officer has clarified that boxes carrying VVPATs found in Managuli village of taluk in district did not belong to the (EC). “Eight VVPAT-carrying cases were found in a temporary shed. But they had no machines and papers and lacked the unique electronic tracking number too. This must have been dumped just to create confusion. We will initiate strict action against those who are trying to create confusion,” Kumar said. Kumar also said no VVPAT machines were found at the spot when the deputy commissioner and the superintendent of police personally visited the site and conducted inspection. On Tuesday, had written to the Chief Election Commissioner (CEC), alleging ‘grave irregularities’ in the assembly elections, citing the Managuli incident.
description: Karnataka’s Chief Electoral Officer Sanjiv Kumar has clarified that boxes carrying VVPATs found in Managuli village of Basavana Bagewadi taluk in Vijayapura district did not belong to the Election Commission (EC).  BS Yeddyurappa had written to the Chief Election Commissioner (CEC), alleging ‘grave irregularities’ in the Karnataka assembly elections.
